articles.title: Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Works Held Abroad
Birthday of Kim Jong Il Celebrated Abroad
Cause of Korean People Supported
articles.content:
Cause of Korean People Supported 
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Lebanese President Emile Lahoud when meeting DPRK ambassador to Lebanon Kim Hyong Jun who paid a farewell call on him on Jan. 30 said the Lebanese government and people hope that the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula would be peacefully solved through dialogue and negotiation and Korea's reunification would be achieved at an early date.
 Saying that the two countries have long-standing friendly relations, he said that the Korean people have always expressed invariable support to the Lebanese people in their struggle to regain the occupied territory and defend their right.

Preparatory Committee Formed in Venezuela
articles.content:
Preparatory Committee Formed in Venezuela 
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- A Venezuela preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16, the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il, was formed in Palabecino City on January 28.
 General Secretary of the Venezuela-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association Aura Contreras was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The committee decided to hold various functions on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and February holiday.

articles.title: Preparatory Committee Formed in Barbados
articles.content:
Preparatory Committee Formed in Barbados 
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of a Barbados preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun and February 16, the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il, was held in Bridgetown on January 27.
 At the ceremony David Denny, chairman of the Barbados Committee for Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The committee set a period from February 1 to the end of April as a "period for celebrating the Sun of the 21st century." It decided to organize colorful functions including meeting and exhibition and conduct activities for introducing the personalities and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as great men in the period.

articles.title: Korean National Heritage Shining with Songun Policy
Orientation of Struggle of South Headquarters of Pomminryon Decided
articles.content:
Orientation of Struggle of South Headquarters of Pomminryon Decided
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification (Pomminryon) reportedly held a training course for figures concerned with reunification from Jan.31 to Feb. 1 to decide on the orientation of the reunification movement for this year and methods of struggle in the run-up to the "general election".
 The organization recalled that a joint resolution on the issues of building the structure of the Korean nation's confrontation with the United States through practical actions and  national cooperation under the banner of the Korean nation-first spirit, struggling against the U.S and war, strengthening solidarity among the three parties and fighting for the legalization of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon and the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils and other matters was adopted at the meeting of its temporary co-presidium held on Jan. 29.    
 Noting that in the era after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration there is the confrontation between those forces supporting it and those forces opposing it, the organization decided to focus on the struggle against the south Korean Grand National Party in order to create a favorable political climate for the implementation of the joint declaration. 
 To this end, it declared to form the solidarity for the 17th general election to bring about an era of reunification and new politics comprising public figures of various strata till Feb. 10 and conduct brisk actions for solidarity with the forces opposed to the GNP.

Greetings to Grenadian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Grenadian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA)  --  Pak  Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Keith Mitchell, prime minister of Grenada, on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to favorably develop, the message wished him and the Grenadian people greater success in their work for the prosperity of the country.
